TopicTitle: We're looking for a few good testers!

Articles.Content:
<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1uPMctN"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/923f7eae1e4c734a68bdf5ac9acd6582/tumblr_inline_n9n92hH7Gn1rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p><span>Think you have what it takes to help us make future updates be the very best they can be? Are you able to think critically, analyze constructively and play <em>KSP</em> in a different light? Fill out <a href="http://bit.ly/1uPMctN"><strong>THIS FORM</strong></a> and you may be called upon to join our experimental testing team.</span></p>

<p><span><span>Thanks to alltherobots for the pic.</span></span></p>

I've applied. You've got a well thought-out form there, good job!

EDIT: but screw you for not mentioning age requirements. You could have saved me a lot of time by making it clear.

Edited August 13, 2014 by Javster

Question: The form asks whether we'd be interested in joining the QA team if we were offered it. It says the QA team tests more frequently, but how much is "more frequently" - does that mean more intensely per week, or more weeks than the experimental team is testing?
Good form. I especially liked the last question.
Applied. I liked that last question. Also, I have doubts that I will get in
I hope as well to get in. I like your guys synchronized tongues...

Question: The form asks whether we'd be interested in joining the QA team if we were offered it. It says the QA team tests more frequently, but how much is "more frequently" - does that mean more intensely per week, or more weeks than the experimental team is testing?

I'm curious about this as well. I went ahead and checked "yes" for the time-being.

I was considering signing up, but I noticed that there was a NDA. Now being a minor, this lowered my hopes because minors cannot sign NDAs unless it is taken into court which I'd rather not do

.

I was considering signing up, but I noticed that there was a NDA. Now being a minor, this lowered my hopes because minors cannot sign NDAs unless it is taken into court which I'd rather not do

.

They've said elsewhere that only those over 18 can be testers, for that very reason.

Question: The form asks whether we'd be interested in joining the QA team if we were offered it. It says the QA team tests more frequently, but how much is "more frequently" - does that mean more intensely per week, or more weeks than the experimental team is testing?
QA team is generally the devs' testing team for "is this feature worth continuing on/developing further". Ted could tell you more, but as far as I'm aware he's currently on leave... I myself don't take part in the QA testing at all, so I've only a general idea of what goes on, but as I understand it they test any new features the devs plan on adding, so that development time isn't totally taken up by a feature that ends up getting shelved or thrown away.
I was considering signing up, but I noticed that there was a NDA. Now being a minor, this lowered my hopes because minors cannot sign NDAs unless it is taken into court which I'd rather not do

.

Aye, you need to be over 18 in order to be considered for a position on the Experimentals, QA, and also on the forum moderation team. Legal issues are a pain, but Squad have to be sure that if something goes horribly wrong, they can tidy it up and make sure it's going to go too badly.

Aye, you need to be over 18 in order to be considered for a position on the Experimentals, QA, and also on the forum moderation team. Legal issues are a pain, but Squad have to be sure that if something goes horribly wrong, they can tidy it up and make sure it's going to go too badly.

Bad case of misinformation if it's not obviously stated on the form... It would probably narrow down the number of entries if you'd made yourselves clearer.

Bad case of misinformation if it's not obviously stated on the form... It would probably narrow down the number of entries if you'd made yourselves clearer.

That's always been the case; minors cannot sign legal agreements, therefore cannot legally apply for positions requiring an NDA signature.

Expecting otherwise isn't a realistic expectation. Sad but true.

I applied. I liked the last question too.

I hope you don't mind my essay for the answer, including mentioning the software project named for the same reference, due to it's subjective nature.

I also gave a few facts that some people might miss.

Aye, you need to be over 18 in order to be considered for a position on the Experimentals, QA, and also on the forum moderation team. Legal issues are a pain, but Squad have to be sure that if somethinhorribly wrong, they can tidy it up and make sure it's going to go too badly.

Didn't know you had to be 18 for Q&A. I'll be 18 in mid-September and there was no easy way to say "I'm basically 18 but not quite". The awkward senior year. Good luck to all who auditioned.
